org.zeromq.api

Class Message

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.zeromq.api.Message
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<Message.Frame>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    RoutedMessage

    public class Message
extends Object
implements Iterable<Message.Frame>
    Message containing frames for sending data via a socket.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Message.Frame
      Represents a single frame of data within a message.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Charset CHARSET
      Default charset, to be customized by the application, or set via property.
      static Message.Frame EMPTY_FRAME
      A handy reference to an empty Message.Frame.
      static byte[] EMPTY_FRAME_DATA
      An empty byte array.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Message()
      Construct an empty message.
      Message(byte[] firstFrame)
      Construct a message with a single byte[] frame.
      Message(int firstFrame)
      Construct a message with a single frame.
      Message(List<Message.Frame> frames)
      Construct a message with the given frames.
      Message(long firstFrame)
      Construct a message with a single frame.
      Message(Message.Frame firstFrame)
      Construct a message with a single frame.
      Message(Message message)
      Construct a message by cloning the given message's frames.
      Message(String firstFrame)
      Construct a message with a single String frame.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Add a frame to the beginning of the list.
      void pushFrames(List<Message.Frame> frames)
      Add frames to the end of the list, in reverse order, such that the elements are in the same order as in the original message.

      Add frames to the beginning of the list, in reverse order, such that the elements are in the same order as in the original message.

      Returns the number of frames in this message.

      • pushFrames

        public void pushFrames(List<Message.Frame> frames)
        Add frames to the end of the list, in reverse order, such that the elements are in the same order as in the original message.
        Parameters:
        frames - The frames to be added

      • pushFrames

        public void pushFrames(Message payload)
        Add frames to the beginning of the list, in reverse order, such that the elements are in the same order as in the original message.
        Parameters:
        payload - The original message, containing frames to be added

      • dump

        protected StringBuilder dump(StringBuilder sb)
        Dump the message in human readable format.

        This should only be used for debugging and tracing, inefficient in handling large messages.

        Returns:
        A StringBuilder with the message in human readable format
